name: exist
content:
exist verb [I]
(BE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 to be, or to be real: I don't think ghosts exist. Poverty still exists in this country.
More examplesFewer examplesIt's in the poorer, underdeveloped eastern region of the country that the biggest problems exist.The English king, Arthur, is a somewhat shadowy figure who may not have even existed.Slavery still exists in many parts of the world.Laws exist to stop companies exploiting their employees.A special closeness is supposed to exist between twins.

(LIVE)

exist verb [I]
(TO BE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to be; have the ability to be known, recognized, or understood: Can the mind exist independently of the body? Programs like Medicaid for the poor did not exist at that time.
exist verb [I]
(BE PRESENT)
to be present or be a condition: Your local agency can tell you if a similar program exists in your community.
exist verb [I]
(LIVE)
to be able to live: No one can be expected to exist on such a low salary.
